elements.content: Two Co(II) metal–organic frameworks with 2,2′-dinitrobiphenyl-4,4′-dicarboxylate (dnpdc) and different dipyridyl ligands have been synthesized by hydrothermal methods. They exhibit different three-dimensional mixed-connected net topologies with either interpenetration or self-catenation features. With dnpdc and 4,4′-bipyridine as cobridging ligands, compound 1 displays 3-fold interpenetrated (4,6)-connected nets based on mononuclear and binuclear nodes. With dnpdc and bis(4-pyridyl)ethane as cobridging ligands, compound 2 exhibits a novel (6,8)-connected net based on two different binuclear nodes, with a high degree of self-catenation arising from the interconnection of “interpenetrated” 2D subnets.
elements.clean_text: Two Co(II) metal-organic frameworks with 2,2'-dinitrobiphenyl-4,4'-dicarboxylate (dnpdc) and different dipyridyl ligands have been synthesized by hydrothermal methods. They exhibit different three-dimensional mixed-connected net topologies with either interpenetration or self-catenation features. With dnpdc and 4,4'-bipyridine as cobridging ligands, compound 1 displays 3-fold interpenetrated (4,6)-connected nets based on mononuclear and binuclear nodes. With dnpdc and bis(4-pyridyl)ethane as cobridging ligands, compound 2 exhibits a novel (6,8)-connected net based on two different binuclear nodes, with a high degree of self-catenation arising from the interconnection of "interpenetrated" 2D subnets.

elements.content: Two Co(II) MOFs with 2,2′-dinitrobiphenyl-4,4′-dicarboxylate and different dipyridyl ligands exhibit novel 3D topologies: three-fold interpenetration of unusual (4,6)-connected nets, and a novel (6,8)-connected net with a high degree of self-catenation.
elements.clean_text: Two Co(II) MOFs with 2,2'-dinitrobiphenyl-4,4'-dicarboxylate and different dipyridyl ligands exhibit novel 3D topologies: three-fold interpenetration of unusual (4,6)-connected nets, and a novel (6,8)-connected net with a high degree of self-catenation.

elements.content: Metal–organic frameworks (MOFs) have caused an upsurge of interest not only for their potential applications in gas adsorption, catalysis, ion exchange, etc. but also for their intriguing variety of architectures and topologies. The topological analysis of multitudinous networks has been an active topic of research, which is not only an important tool for simplifying complicated structures but also plays an instructive role in the rational design of materials with specific structures and desired properties. The explosive growth of the number of MOFs has led to an increasing emphasis toward identifying and classifying the underlying topologies, and this work has been greatly aided by databases and computer programs designed for this purpose. In the past decades, many 3D structures with mixed-connected topologies, for example, Pt3O4, SrSi2, boracites, and anatase, have been realized in MOFs. However, there is an unfavorable lack of systematic investigation on mixed- and high-connected frameworks, which is still a challenging task because of the uncontrollability of the interplay between different building units and the limited attainability of high-connected building units.
elements.clean_text: Metal-organic frameworks (MOFs) have caused an upsurge of interest not only for their potential applications in gas adsorption, catalysis, ion exchange, etc. but also for their intriguing variety of architectures and topologies. The topological analysis of multitudinous networks has been an active topic of research, which is not only an important tool for simplifying complicated structures but also plays an instructive role in the rational design of materials with specific structures and desired properties. The explosive growth of the number of MOFs has led to an increasing emphasis toward identifying and classifying the underlying topologies, and this work has been greatly aided by databases and computer programs designed for this purpose. In the past decades, many 3D structures with mixed-connected topologies, for example, Pt3O4, SrSi2, boracites, and anatase, have been realized in MOFs. However, there is an unfavorable lack of systematic investigation on mixed- and high-connected frameworks, which is still a challenging task because of the uncontrollability of the interplay between different building units and the limited attainability of high-connected building units.

elements.content: Among fascinating phenomena contributing much to the topological diversity are the interpenetration and polycatenation between separate motifs, which, as a special way of the nature to avoid voids, is frequently encountered in MOFs. Much less common is self-catenation (or self-penetration), a peculiar type of entanglement for which the mutually catenated rings belong to the same net. Although the prediction and design of self-catenation are still a formidable challenge, it has evoked increasing interest recently.
elements.clean_text: Among fascinating phenomena contributing much to the topological diversity are the interpenetration and polycatenation between separate motifs, which, as a special way of the nature to avoid voids, is frequently encountered in MOFs. Much less common is self-catenation (or self-penetration), a peculiar type of entanglement for which the mutually catenated rings belong to the same net. Although the prediction and design of self-catenation are still a formidable challenge, it has evoked increasing interest recently.

elements.content: Here we report two new mixed-connected 3D frameworks, {[Co3(dnpdc)3(bipy)3(H2O)2]·2H2O} n (1) and {[Co3(dnpdc)3(bpea)2.5(H2O)3]·0.5H2O} n (2), derived from the nitro-functionalized dicarboxylate ligand 2,2′-dinitrobiphenyl-4,4′-dicarboxylic acid (H2dnpdc) and different dipyridyl ligands (bipy = 4,4′-bipyridine and bpea = bis(4-pyridyl)ethane) by hydrothermal methods. The choice of the ligands is based on the following considerations: (i) the multidentate carboxylate groups may induce cluster aggregation and link the clusters into extended networks; (ii) the nitro group is not involved in coordination (However, it can impose influences upon the coordination and the framework due to its electronegative and steric effects. In particular, the 2,2′-substituents in dnpdc make the two benzoate moieties twist mutually, thus rendering an organic building block that is geometrically different from the mother ligand and hence may lead to new topologies.); (iii) the dipyridyl bridging ligands can complement the dicarboxylate ligands in coordination and make for the formation of high-connected nets. The two MOFs presented here exhibit very different 3D structures despite the minor difference in dipyridyl ligands. 1 displays 3-fold interpenetration of unusual (4,6)-connected nets based on mononuclear and binuclear nodes, while 2 represents a novel (6,8)-connected net based on two different binuclear nodes, with thus far the highest degree of self-catenation.
elements.clean_text: Here we report two new mixed-connected 3D frameworks, {[Co3(dnpdc)3(bipy)3(H2O)2]⋅2H2O} n  (1) and {[Co3(dnpdc)3(bpea)2.5(H2O)3]⋅0.5H2O} n  (2), derived from the nitro-functionalized dicarboxylate ligand 2,2'-dinitrobiphenyl-4,4'-dicarboxylic acid (H2dnpdc) and different dipyridyl ligands (bipy = 4,4'-bipyridine and bpea = bis(4-pyridyl)ethane) by hydrothermal methods. The choice of the ligands is based on the following considerations: (i) the multidentate carboxylate groups may induce cluster aggregation and link the clusters into extended networks; (ii) the nitro group is not involved in coordination (However, it can impose influences upon the coordination and the framework due to its electronegative and steric effects. In particular, the 2,2'-substituents in dnpdc make the two benzoate moieties twist mutually, thus rendering an organic building block that is geometrically different from the mother ligand and hence may lead to new topologies.); (iii) the dipyridyl bridging ligands can complement the dicarboxylate ligands in coordination and make for the formation of high-connected nets. The two MOFs presented here exhibit very different 3D structures despite the minor difference in dipyridyl ligands. 1 displays 3-fold interpenetration of unusual (4,6)-connected nets based on mononuclear and binuclear nodes, while 2 represents a novel (6,8)-connected net based on two different binuclear nodes, with thus far the highest degree of self-catenation.

elements.content: According to X-ray crystallographic analysis, there are two crystallographically independent cobalt ions in 1, both adopting the [N2O4] pseudo-octahedral geometry (Figure and Figure S1 of the ). Co1 is coordinated by four equatorial oxygens from three carboxylates, and two axial nitrogens from bipy ligands, while Co2 resides on the inversion center and is ligated by two monodentate carboxylates, two nitrogen atoms, and two water molecules. Two Co1 atoms are linked by two μ-1,3-carboxylate bridges to give a centrosymmetric binuclear Co2(COO)2 unit with Co···Co = 4.160(6) Å.
elements.clean_text: According to X-ray crystallographic analysis, there are two crystallographically independent cobalt ions in 1, both adopting the [N2O4] pseudo-octahedral geometry (Figure  and Figure S1 of the ). Co1 is coordinated by four equatorial oxygens from three carboxylates, and two axial nitrogens from bipy ligands, while Co2 resides on the inversion center and is ligated by two monodentate carboxylates, two nitrogen atoms, and two water molecules. Two Co1 atoms are linked by two μ-1,3-carboxylate bridges to give a centrosymmetric binuclear Co2(COO)2 unit with Co⋅⋅⋅Co = 4.160(6) Å.

elements.content: Views of the 4- and 6-connected building units in 1.
elements.clean_text: 1  Views of the 4- and 6-connected building units in 1.

elements.content: The 3D structure is formed by the dnpdc and bipy ligands interlinking binuclear and mononuclear units (Figures and ). Two different coordination modes are assumed by dnpdc (a and b): μ2,η4 (each carboxylate chelating a Co1) and μ3,η3 (a monodentate carboxylate binding Co2 and a μ-1,3-carboxylate binding two Co1’s). The binuclear units are linked by pairwise bipy ligands into 1D ladder-shaped chains in the [101] direction, and the μ2,η4-bis(chelating) dnpdc ligands link the ladders into a 2D sheet along the ac plane (Figure b). The mononuclear Co2 units are linked by bipy ligands into 1D linear chains along the [102] direction (Figure a). Each Co2 is also linked to two binuclear units by two μ3,η3-dnpdc ligands. As a result, a complicated 3D framework is formed, in which the linear chains of Co2 are linked to and sandwiched between the 2D sheets based on binuclear units.
elements.clean_text: The 3D structure is formed by the dnpdc and bipy ligands interlinking binuclear and mononuclear units (Figures  and ). Two different coordination modes are assumed by dnpdc (a and b): μ2,η4 (each carboxylate chelating a Co1) and μ3,η3 (a monodentate carboxylate binding Co2 and a μ-1,3-carboxylate binding two Co1's). The binuclear units are linked by pairwise bipy ligands into 1D ladder-shaped chains in the [101] direction, and the μ2,η4-bis(chelating) dnpdc ligands link the ladders into a 2D sheet along the ac plane (Figure b). The mononuclear Co2 units are linked by bipy ligands into 1D linear chains along the [102] direction (Figure a). Each Co2 is also linked to two binuclear units by two μ3,η3-dnpdc ligands. As a result, a complicated 3D framework is formed, in which the linear chains of Co2 are linked to and sandwiched between the 2D sheets based on binuclear units.

elements.content: Views of the structure of 1 (nitro groups are omitted for clarity), showing the 1D chain of bipy and Co2 (a), the 2D sheet composed of bipy, dnpdc, and Co1 (b), and the 3D framework (c).
elements.clean_text: 2  Views of the structure of 1 (nitro groups are omitted for clarity), showing the 1D chain of bipy and Co2 (a), the 2D sheet composed of bipy, dnpdc, and Co1 (b), and the 3D framework (c).

elements.content: As shown in Figure , each binuclear unit is connected to four binuclear and two mononuclear units, and each mononuclear unit to two binuclear and two mononuclear units. Topologically, the 3D framework represents a 3D (4,6)-connected binodal net with four independent linkers and with point symbol (44·62)(48·66·8). This topology has been theoretically expected (tcj-4,6-Pna21; for details, see the output of the TOPOS program given in the ) but not yet observed in MOFs prior to this work. To gain a better understanding, the (4,6)-connected net can be regarded as being derived from the simpler 6-connected net rob (point symbol: 48·66·8) (Figure ), which is the first MOF example of 3D self-catenated nets. It has been described as parallel (4,4) sheets being linked by linear and inclined pillars, and self-catenation occurs because of the criss-cross arrangement of the interlayer pillars. In the rob subnet of 1, the pillar is composed of two dnpdc ligands connected by a Co2 atom (Figure a). In the overall structure, the centers (Co2 atoms) of the criss-cross pillars are connected into chains by bipy to generate the new (4,6)-connected topology (Figure a) with Co2 as the additional 4-connecting node. The self-catenation feature disappears because the catenated rings in the subnet are now directly connected.
elements.clean_text: As shown in Figure , each binuclear unit is connected to four binuclear and two mononuclear units, and each mononuclear unit to two binuclear and two mononuclear units. Topologically, the 3D framework represents a 3D (4,6)-connected binodal net with four independent linkers and with point symbol (44⋅62)(48⋅66⋅8). This topology has been theoretically expected (tcj-4,6-Pna21; for details, see the output of the TOPOS program given in the ) but not yet observed in MOFs prior to this work. To gain a better understanding, the (4,6)-connected net can be regarded as being derived from the simpler 6-connected net rob (point symbol: 48⋅66⋅8) (Figure ), which is the first MOF example of 3D self-catenated nets. It has been described as parallel (4,4) sheets being linked by linear and inclined pillars, and self-catenation occurs because of the criss-cross arrangement of the interlayer pillars. In the rob subnet of 1, the pillar is composed of two dnpdc ligands connected by a Co2 atom (Figure a). In the overall structure, the centers (Co2 atoms) of the criss-cross pillars are connected into chains by bipy to generate the new (4,6)-connected topology (Figure a) with Co2 as the additional 4-connecting node. The self-catenation feature disappears because the catenated rings in the subnet are now directly connected.

elements.content: Schematic views showing the derivation of the new (4,6)-connected net (b) from the known 6-connected rob net (a), and the 3-fold interpenetration (c) in 1.
elements.clean_text: 3  Schematic views showing the derivation of the new (4,6)-connected net (b) from the known 6-connected rob net (a), and the 3-fold interpenetration (c) in 1.

elements.content: A single framework in 1 possesses a large 3D-connected void space, which is mainly filled via 3-fold interpenetration (Figure c): each window of the (4,4) sheets in one net is threaded by two interlayer linkers from other two nets. The small voids left after interpenetration, comprising only 16.1% of the crystal volume, are occupied by water molecules. Thermogravimetric analysis (Figure S3, ) suggests that the guest water molecules are readily removed upon heating below 100 °C. Powder X-ray diffraction measurements (Figure S4, ) suggest that the framework is stable upon removal of the guest molecules.
elements.clean_text: A single framework in 1 possesses a large 3D-connected void space, which is mainly filled via 3-fold interpenetration (Figure c): each window of the (4,4) sheets in one net is threaded by two interlayer linkers from other two nets. The small voids left after interpenetration, comprising only 16.1% of the crystal volume, are occupied by water molecules. Thermogravimetric analysis (Figure S3, ) suggests that the guest water molecules are readily removed upon heating below 100 °C. Powder X-ray diffraction measurements (Figure S4, ) suggest that the framework is stable upon removal of the guest molecules.

elements.content: When the rigid bipy ligand was replaced by the flexible and longer bpea ligand, we obtained compound 2, which exhibits a complicated 3D self-catenated network. There are three crystallographically independent Co(II) ions, all adopting the octahedral geometry. Co1 and Co2 are triply linked through μ-1,3-carboxylate, μ-1,1-carboxylate, and μ-aqua, to generate a binuclear Co2(μ-O)(μ-OH2)(μ-COO) unit (denoted as A unit hereafter, Figure ), with Co···Co = 3.288(8) Å. Differently, two equivalent Co3 ions are connected by two μ-1,3-carboxylate bridges to generate a centrosymmetric binuclear Co2(COO)2 unit (denoted as B unit hereafter) with Co···Co = 4.501(14) Å. The dnpdc ligand displays three different coordination modes (b–d), namely, μ3,η3 as that in 1, μ2,η2 with two monodentate carboxylates, and μ4,η3 with μ-1,3 and μ-1,1 carboxylates.
elements.clean_text: When the rigid bipy ligand was replaced by the flexible and longer bpea ligand, we obtained compound 2, which exhibits a complicated 3D self-catenated network. There are three crystallographically independent Co(II) ions, all adopting the octahedral geometry. Co1 and Co2 are triply linked through μ-1,3-carboxylate, μ-1,1-carboxylate, and μ-aqua, to generate a binuclear Co2(μ-O)(μ-OH2)(μ-COO) unit (denoted as A unit hereafter, Figure ), with Co⋅⋅⋅Co = 3.288(8) Å. Differently, two equivalent Co3 ions are connected by two μ-1,3-carboxylate bridges to generate a centrosymmetric binuclear Co2(COO)2 unit (denoted as B unit hereafter) with Co⋅⋅⋅Co = 4.501(14) Å. The dnpdc ligand displays three different coordination modes (b-d), namely, μ3,η3 as that in 1, μ2,η2 with two monodentate carboxylates, and μ4,η3 with μ-1,3 and μ-1,1 carboxylates.

elements.content: Views of the 6- and 8-connected binuclear units in 2. For clarity, nitro groups and the alternative positions of the disordered bpea ligands have been omitted.
elements.clean_text: 4  Views of the 6- and 8-connected binuclear units in 2. For clarity, nitro groups and the alternative positions of the disordered bpea ligands have been omitted.

elements.content: As shown in Figure , each A unit is six-connected to three A units and three B units, while each B unit is eight-connected to six A units and two B units. The resulting (6,8)-connected 3D framework is very complicated, and we describe it in a bottom-up way as follows. First, the binuclear units are connected by bpea ligands to form two characteristic linear chain motifs along the b direction, one (A chain, cyan in Figure ) from A units and one (B chain, purple in Figure ) from B units. Then, through μ4,η3-dnpdc and other bpea ligands, each B chain is connected to four A chains and each A chain is connected to two B chains, producing a novel (4,6)-connected 2D layer parallel to the ab plane (Figure a). A side view illustrates that the layer features rhombic channels and side windows (Figure b). Two such layers (red- and blue-colored, respectively, in Figure c) sharing the central plane interpenetrate each other with the B chains from one layer threading the channels of the other layer, representing a new pattern of 2D-to-2D parallel interpenetration. The two “interpenetrated” layers are interconnected into a bilayered 2D network by μ2,η2-dnpdc (yellow lines in Figure c), which bridges A units from different layers. Obviously, this peculiar bilayered network features self-catenation, and it represents an unprecedented (5,6)-connected 2D net with point symbol (410·65)(47·63)2. Finally, adjacent bilayers are linked into a 3D framework by μ3,η3-dnpdc (green lines in Figure c), which bridges an A unit from one layer and a B unit from another layer.
elements.clean_text: As shown in Figure , each A unit is six-connected to three A units and three B units, while each B unit is eight-connected to six A units and two B units. The resulting (6,8)-connected 3D framework is very complicated, and we describe it in a bottom-up way as follows. First, the binuclear units are connected by bpea ligands to form two characteristic linear chain motifs along the b direction, one (A chain, cyan in Figure ) from A units and one (B chain, purple in Figure ) from B units. Then, through μ4,η3-dnpdc and other bpea ligands, each B chain is connected to four A chains and each A chain is connected to two B chains, producing a novel (4,6)-connected 2D layer parallel to the ab plane (Figure a). A side view illustrates that the layer features rhombic channels and side windows (Figure b). Two such layers (red- and blue-colored, respectively, in Figure c) sharing the central plane interpenetrate each other with the B chains from one layer threading the channels of the other layer, representing a new pattern of 2D-to-2D parallel interpenetration. The two "interpenetrated" layers are interconnected into a bilayered 2D network by μ2,η2-dnpdc (yellow lines in Figure c), which bridges A units from different layers. Obviously, this peculiar bilayered network features self-catenation, and it represents an unprecedented (5,6)-connected 2D net with point symbol (410⋅65)(47⋅63)2. Finally, adjacent bilayers are linked into a 3D framework by μ3,η3-dnpdc (green lines in Figure c), which bridges an A unit from one layer and a B unit from another layer.

elements.content: Views of the (4,6)-connected 2D layer (a, top view; b, side view showing the rhombic channels) and the (6,8)-connected net (c) for 2.
elements.clean_text: 5  Views of the (4,6)-connected 2D layer (a, top view; b, side view showing the rhombic channels) and the (6,8)-connected net (c) for 2.

elements.content: According to topological analysis, the (6,8)-connected net of 2 has a point symbol of (411·64)2(418·610), representing a brand-new 3D topology featuring multiple self-catenation. MOF examples of (6,8)-connected nets are still very rare. The RCSR database lists four (6,8)-connected 3D nets: ocu, sea, seh, and tph, which, except for sea, have not yet been recognized in real MOFs. All these nets do not display self-catenation. Recently, Su and co-workers reported a Zn(II) MOF that represents the first self-catenated (6,8)-connected net (point symbol (412·5·62)(420·52·66), in which the single catenation component occurs between the four-membered circuits composed of six- and eight-connected nodes, respectively). The new net observed in 2 is clearly different from the above nets and displays very complicated multiple catenations between four-membered circuits. The self-catenation obviously arises from the unusual interconnection of the “interpenetrated” (4,6)-connected layer components. As shown in Figure , the A-B-A-B circuit (I) defining the rhombic channel of the layer (A and B refer to the different nodes defined vide supra) is six-catenated because it is threaded by a single B–B edge shared by three independent pairs of A-A–B-B circuits. An A-A–B-B circuit (II) that defines the side window of the layer is also six-catenated with three pairs of circuits, but it is threaded by three edges that form a zigzag shape (A-A-B-A). The A-A-A-A circuit (III) generated by connecting the layers into bilayers is threaded by two parallel A-B edges and is catenated with four circuits II. The A-B-A-B circuit (IV) between the bilayers is threaded by two parallel A-A edges, each shared by four different circuits, so circuit IV is eight-catenated. The complicated net represents a high-connected 3D system with, thus far, the highest degree of self-catenation.
elements.clean_text: According to topological analysis, the (6,8)-connected net of 2 has a point symbol of (411⋅64)2(418⋅610), representing a brand-new 3D topology featuring multiple self-catenation. MOF examples of (6,8)-connected nets are still very rare. The RCSR database lists four (6,8)-connected 3D nets: ocu, sea, seh, and tph, which, except for sea, have not yet been recognized in real MOFs. All these nets do not display self-catenation. Recently, Su and co-workers reported a Zn(II) MOF that represents the first self-catenated (6,8)-connected net (point symbol (412⋅5⋅62)(420⋅52⋅66), in which the single catenation component occurs between the four-membered circuits composed of six- and eight-connected nodes, respectively). The new net observed in 2 is clearly different from the above nets and displays very complicated multiple catenations between four-membered circuits. The self-catenation obviously arises from the unusual interconnection of the "interpenetrated" (4,6)-connected layer components. As shown in Figure , the A-B-A-B circuit (I) defining the rhombic channel of the layer (A and B refer to the different nodes defined vide supra) is six-catenated because it is threaded by a single B-B edge shared by three independent pairs of A-A-B-B circuits. An A-A-B-B circuit (II) that defines the side window of the layer is also six-catenated with three pairs of circuits, but it is threaded by three edges that form a zigzag shape (A-A-B-A). The A-A-A-A circuit (III) generated by connecting the layers into bilayers is threaded by two parallel A-B edges and is catenated with four circuits II. The A-B-A-B circuit (IV) between the bilayers is threaded by two parallel A-A edges, each shared by four different circuits, so circuit IV is eight-catenated. The complicated net represents a high-connected 3D system with, thus far, the highest degree of self-catenation.

elements.content: Multiple catenations of the four-membered circuits in 2. The color scheme is the same as in Figure c, and the Roman numerals refer to the bolded circuits.
elements.clean_text: 6  Multiple catenations of the four-membered circuits in 2. The color scheme is the same as in Figure c, and the Roman numerals refer to the bolded circuits.

elements.content: In conclusion, we have described two 3D Co(II) MOFs derived from dnpdc. With bipy as coligand, 1 displays 3-fold interpenetration, and the (4,6)-connected single net is related to a self-catenated 6-connected net. With the longer bpea coligand, 2 illustrates a brand-new (6,8)-connected net with, thus far, the highest degree of self-catenation, which arises from the unusual interconnection of “interpenetrated” 2D subnets and fills a lacuna for multiple self-catenation in high-connected nets. This work emphasizes the great fascination, potentials, and challenges in constructing and designing MOFs with new entanglement topologies.
elements.clean_text: In conclusion, we have described two 3D Co(II) MOFs derived from dnpdc. With bipy as coligand, 1 displays 3-fold interpenetration, and the (4,6)-connected single net is related to a self-catenated 6-connected net. With the longer bpea coligand, 2 illustrates a brand-new (6,8)-connected net with, thus far, the highest degree of self-catenation, which arises from the unusual interconnection of "interpenetrated" 2D subnets and fills a lacuna for multiple self-catenation in high-connected nets. This work emphasizes the great fascination, potentials, and challenges in constructing and designing MOFs with new entanglement topologies.

elements.content: Details of the experimental measurements and crystallographic studies, structures, TGA curve, PXRD patterns, and computation results for 1 and 2 (PDF format) and X-ray crystallographic information (CIF format). This material is available free of charge via the Internet at http://pubs.acs.org.
elements.clean_text: Details of the experimental measurements and crystallographic studies, structures, TGA curve, PXRD patterns, and computation results for 1 and 2 (PDF format) and X-ray crystallographic information (CIF format). This material is available free of charge via the Internet at http://pubs.acs.org.

elements.content: Synthesis: A mixture of H2dnpdc (0.10 mmol, 0.033 g), Co(NO3)2 (0.10 mmol, 0.031 g), and bipy (0.10 mmol, 0.016 g) in water/ethyl glycol (8/2 mL) was adjusted to pH = 6.5 with 1 M NaOH aqueous solution and then heated at 160 °C for 4 days in a 23 mL Teflon-lined autoclave. After cooling to room temperature slowly, rod crystals of 1 were collected with a yield of 63% based on H2dnpdc. Elem anal. Calcd for C72H50N12O28Co3: C, 50.63; H, 2.95; N, 9.84. Found: C, 50.84; H, 2.86; N, 9.89. IR (KBr, cm–1): 3074w, 1673m, 1611vs, 1532vs,1485w, 1399vs, 1346m, 1219w, 1006w, 913w, 812m, 707m. A similar procedure was followed to prepare compound 2, except that bipy was replaced by bpea (0.1 mmol, 0.019 g). After the reaction mixture was cooled to room temperature slowly, rod brown crystals of 2 were obtained. The product was always contaminated by uncharacterized phases that were difficult to remove. IR (KBr, cm–1): 3583b, 3073w, 1674m, 1611vs, 1532vs, 1486w, 1400vs, 1346m, 1219w, 1092w, 1066w, 911w, 856w, 813m, 707m.
elements.clean_text:
References

A similar procedure was followed to prepare compound 2, except that bipy was replaced by bpea (0.1 mmol, 0.019 g). After the reaction mixture was cooled to room temperature slowly, rod brown crystals of 2 were obtained. The product was always contaminated by uncharacterized phases that were difficult to remove. IR (KBr, cm-1): 3583b, 3073w, 1674m, 1611vs, 1532vs, 1486w, 1400vs, 1346m, 1219w, 1092w, 1066w, 911w, 856w, 813m, 707m.

elements.content: Although the topology was not analyzed in the following papers, a few MOFs reported therein can be classified under sea, with the 6- and 8-connnected nodes being metal ions and teracarboxylate ligands, respectively.
elements.clean_text: Although the topology was not analyzed in the following papers, a few MOFs reported therein can be classified under sea, with the 6- and 8-connnected nodes being metal ions and teracarboxylate ligands, respectively.

elements.content:
The seh and tph nets correspond to the lattices of the binary compounds PdSb and Th3P4, respectively.

Very recently, the ocu net has been recognized in a hydrogen-bonded network:

cln_elements.content: Synthesis: A mixture of H2dnpdc (0.10 mmol, 0.033 g), Co(NO3)2 (0.10 mmol, 0.031 g), and bipy (0.10 mmol, 0.016 g) in water/ethyl glycol (8/2 mL) was adjusted to pH = 6.5 with 1 M NaOH aqueous solution and then heated at 160 °C for 4 days in a 23 mL Teflon-lined autoclave. After cooling to room temperature slowly, rod crystals of 1 were collected with a yield of 63% based on H2dnpdc. Elem anal. Calcd for C72H50N12O28Co3: C, 50.63; H, 2.95; N, 9.84. Found: C, 50.84; H, 2.86; N, 9.89. IR (KBr, cm–1): 3074w, 1673m, 1611vs, 1532vs,1485w, 1399vs, 1346m, 1219w, 1006w, 913w, 812m, 707m. A similar procedure was followed to prepare compound 2, except that bipy was replaced by bpea (0.1 mmol, 0.019 g). After the reaction mixture was cooled to room temperature slowly, rod brown crystals of 2 were obtained. The product was always contaminated by uncharacterized phases that were difficult to remove. IR (KBr, cm–1): 3583b, 3073w, 1674m, 1611vs, 1532vs, 1486w, 1400vs, 1346m, 1219w, 1092w, 1066w, 911w, 856w, 813m, 707m.

After cooling to room temperature slowly, rod crystals of 1 were collected with a yield of 63% based on H2dnpdc. Elem anal. Calcd for C72H50N12O28Co3: C, 50.63; H, 2.95; N, 9.84. metadata.title: Interpenetration, Self-Catenation, and New Topology in Metal–Organic Frameworks of Cobalt with Mixed Organic Linkers
